pr_title: Fix fetching partition for Glue UDB

timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: should this be getPartitionsResult.getPartitions().size() instead of partitions.size()?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: It allows us to track the progress of getPartitions. Is it better to show the total added partitions for the current table?
replies.author: HelloHorizon

replies.bodyText: I think both can be useful. How about something like "Glue table {}.{} adding {} batch partitions with {} total partitions."
replies.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: yeah, it makes sense, I can add both of them.
replies.author: HelloHorizon

timeline.bodyText: Is this large enough? Do you know if we can make this larger while still allowing it to return the correct amount?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: This value means the maximum number of partitions to return in a single response, from 1 to 1000. 256 should large enough for most cases. I will update the explanation of this property.
replies.author: HelloHorizon

replies.bodyText: If we set it to 1000, is it slow? I think setting it larger would be better.
replies.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: I don't know the performance difference with an accurate number, but it should has little difference.
replies.author: HelloHorizon

replies.bodyText: I changed the default value to 512, which should more than enough for most cases.
replies.author: HelloHorizon

replies.bodyText: I changed it to 512, it still only fetch 460 partitions every time, it would not reach the limitation.
replies.author: HelloHorizon

timeline.author: gpang
